text:
Suppose I have two sets of vectors of different size `x1, y1, x2, y2`  that have the same domains and I want to interpolate them so that they are of the same size -- similar to what `plot` does. Is there a good way to do this?
```x1 = [1, 2, 3, 4]
y1 = [ 10, 20, 30, 40]

x2 = [1.5, 3.5, 4.1]
y2 = [10, 30, 40]```

elements.text: Suppose I have two sets of vectors of different size
that have the same domains and I want to interpolate them so that they are of the same size -- similar to what
does. Is there a good way to do this?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/suppose-i-have-two-sets-of-vectors-of-different-size-x1-y1-x2-y2-that-have-t/54632|to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
what do you want your answers to be?  That is, what do you want `newx1` , `newx2`, `newy1`, `newy2` to be?

text: all length 4? `newx2` to match `x1`? `newy2` to be the linear interpolation to the new points?
